channel.title: Interview on Coding N Concepts
channel.description: Recent content in Interview on Coding N Concepts

item.title: Burning Rope Puzzle
item.description:
Problem

You have two ropes of varying thickness and length. Each rope burns in exactly 60 minutes. How can you measure 45 mins using only these two ropes.

Note: You can’t cut the rope in half because of varying thickness and you don’t have a timer or watch to measure the burning time.

item.title: Virutal Dom vs Shadow Dom
item.description: Virtual DOM vs Shadow DOM DOM DOM stands for Document Object Model which is object based representation of any structured content such as HTML, XML etc. Browser maintains DOM object to render the HTML and any change in the DOM object cause re-rendering of the whole page. Virtual DOM Concept of Virtual DOM is adapted by popular UI libraries like React and Vue to solve mainly the performance issue. Virtual DOM is an in-memory representation of the DOM.

item.title: Minimum set of weight puzzle
item.description:
Problem

What is the minimum number of weights needed for a scale that will be able to weigh objects from the weight of one pound to 100 pounds?

item.title: Puzzle - 12 Balls - Odd one out
item.description:
Problem

You have 12 balls identical in size and appearance but 1 is an odd weight (could be either light or heavy).

You have a set scales (balance) which will give 3 possible readings: Left = Right, Left > Right or Left < Right (ie Left and Right have equal weight, Left is Heavier, or Left is Lighter).

You have only 3 chances to weigh the balls in any combination using the scales. Determine which ball is the odd one and if it’s heavier or lighter than the rest. How do you do it?

item.title: Puzzle - 8 Balls - Odd one out
item.description:
Problem

You have 8 balls. One of them is defective and weighs less than others. You have a balance to measure balls against each other. In 2 weightings how do you find the defective one?

item.title: Contaminated Pills Puzzle
item.description:
Problem

You have 5 jars of pills. Each pill weighs 10 gram, except for contaminated pills contained in one jar, where each pill weighs 9 gm. Given a scale, how could you tell which jar had the contaminated pills in just one measurement?”
